PRICE THIS VENUE 1 / 8 Provided by: Royal Palm Events at Madison Green Report Madison Green Country Club 561-556-9314 CALL VENUE FAVORITE Venue highlights Indoor and outdoor spaces Rentals included Valet parking Venue details Style: Golf Course, Ballrooms, Outdoor Guest capacity: Accommodates up to 300 guests Services: Ceremony / Reception Indoor / Outdoor VIEW OPTIONS Location: 2001 Crestwood Boulevard North West Palm Beach, FL 33411 Description: Situated only minutes away from downtown West Palm Beach, The Madison Green Country Club offers a beautiful wedding venue for an upscale wedding. Located only a hop, skip, and a jump away from the Palm Beach International Airport, this gorgeous country club is ideal for a destination wedding or local couples with out of town guests. The spectacular golf course features acres of nature preserves surrounded by scenic Pine Barrens, towering palm trees, and stately oaks, creating an ideal backdrop from a sparkling lakeside ceremony on the finely manicured golf course. The newly renovated Madison Ballroom is an elegant space for celebrating your special day, with coffered ceilings and expansive windows offering sweeping views of the golf course and an abundance of natural light. The neutral color palette makes it an ideal space for personalized decorating, creating a big day that is truly your own! The expert at Madison Green Country Club catering and culinary team will not only ensure that your evening meal is sensational, but also that the entire occasion goes above and beyond your expectations! READ MORE Additional details Service Options Venue notes There is no rental fee for the reception but there is a food and beverage minimum applied to all events. The venue allows 5 hours of event time excluding set up and clean up time. The set up fee for a wedding ceremony ranges from $250 to $700 and includes an extra hour of event time. The fee for a ceremony only wedding is $500. Additional hours can be arranged for a fee of $150/hr. background-color: #d81a14; /* the main color */ width: fit-content; } You are here: Home / Weddings & Events / Ultimate Guide To Wedding Reception Options Near Palm Beach The average person might think there is only one type of wedding reception option. This is not true, around the world there are so many different ways to set up and design a wedding reception. American wedding venues tend to recognize about 7 common options. One of the biggest choices you’ll face is deciding on the type of wedding reception that best fits your vision and needs. Whether you’re engaged and just starting to plan, or you’re knee-deep in wedding planning, understanding your options can help make this part of the process smoother and more enjoyable. Ultimate Guide To Wedding Reception Options Near Palm Beach – if we missed an option, let us know in the comments! 1. Formal Sit-Down Dinner What It Is: A traditional choice for many couples, the formal sit-down dinner features a multi-course meal served to guests while they remain seated. This type of wedding reception is ideal for those who want a classic and elegant atmosphere. Benefits: Structured Dining Experience : Guests are comfortably seated and served, allowing for a more controlled and organized event. Elegance and Class : A sit-down dinner adds a touch of sophistication to your wedding reception. Personal Interaction : You can spend quality time interacting with guests at their tables. Considerations: Cost : Generally, a formal dinner can be more expensive due to the service staff required and multiple courses. Time-Intensive : This type of reception tends to take longer, which might impact how much time you have for other activities like dancing or speeches. Photo provided by the talented Jordan Summer Photography 2. Buffet Style What It Is: A buffet-style reception offers a variety of food options set up at different stations where guests serve themselves. This option is perfect for those who crave variety and want to keep things casual yet festive. Benefits: Variety : A buffet allows you to offer multiple dishes, catering to different tastes and dietary restrictions. Flexibility : Guests can eat at their own pace and choose what they like, creating a relaxed atmosphere. Cost-Effective : Buffets can be more budget-friendly as they typically require fewer serving staff. Considerations: Flow and Lines : There might be a wait at the food stations, so consider having multiple stations to minimize delays. Space Requirements : Buffets require more space for setup and movement. Photo provided by the talented Jordan Summer Photography 3. Cocktail Reception What It Is: A cocktail reception focuses on finger foods, small bites, and drinks, creating a more social and lively atmosphere. This type of reception is ideal for couples who want a modern and chic wedding. Benefits: Social Atmosphere : Encourages mingling and interaction among guests. Variety of Foods : Offers a range of appetizers and hors d’oeuvres. Flexibility : Often more flexible in terms of timing and flow of events. Considerations: Limited Seating : Usually provides less seating, which might not be suitable for all guests. Food Quantity : Ensure there’s enough food to keep guests satisfied over several hours. Ultimate Guide To Wedding Reception Options Near Palm Beach 4. Brunch or Luncheon Reception What It Is: Daytime receptions, such as brunch or luncheon, are becoming increasingly popular. These types of receptions are usually held earlier in the day and feature lighter fare like pastries, salads, and mimosas. Benefits: Cost-Effective : Typically less expensive than evening receptions. Unique and Memorable : Guests might find a daytime event refreshing and unique. More Daylight : Perfect for outdoor settings with natural light. Considerations: Early Start : Guests and the wedding party need to be ready earlier in the day. Limited Evening Activities : The event may wrap up earlier, which might affect travel plans for out-of-town guests. Photo provided by the talented Jordan Summer Photography 5. Destination Wedding Reception What It Is: A destination wedding reception takes place in a location away from home, often in picturesque or exotic settings. This type of reception is perfect for couples looking to combine their wedding and honeymoon into an unforgettable experience. Benefits: Stunning Locations : Offers beautiful and unique backdrops for your wedding photos. Intimate Gathering : Typically involves a smaller guest list, making it more intimate. Built-In Vacation : Guests can enjoy a mini-vacation while attending your wedding. Considerations: Travel Costs : Can be expensive for both the couple and their guests. Logistics : Requires more planning and coordination, especially with travel and accommodations. This is one of our locations where we could host an Al Fresco wedding reception, we would remove the heart shaped backdrop and set up beautiful tables, chairs, linens, lighting, decor and stations here! 6. Al Fresco Wedding Reception An al fresco wedding takes place outdoors, often by our waterfront area or any natural setting. This type of wedding allows for a unique and picturesque backdrop that can’t be replicated indoors. The term “al fresco” is Italian for “in the cool [air],” signifying the refreshing and open nature of these events. Benefits of an Al Fresco Wedding Natural Beauty : One of the most significant advantages of an outdoor wedding is the natural beauty it offers. Nature provides a stunning backdrop, reducing the need for extensive decorations. Flexibility : Outdoor weddings offer more flexibility in terms of space and layout. You can have different zones for dining, dancing, and relaxing. Unique Atmosphere : An al fresco wedding provides a relaxed and informal atmosphere that many couples desire. The open air and natural surroundings create a magical and intimate experience for guests. Your wedding reception is a significant part of your big day, and choosing the right wedding venue is essential if you want choices with your reception style.  At Madison Green Country Club we do our best to ensure that your wedding will feel custom designed to suite your style, design preferences and needs. Of course, if you want to keep planning simple, we can always set up a popular, traditional option. Each type of wedding reception has its own unique benefits and considerations, from the elegance of a formal sit-down dinner to the relaxed vibe of a brunch reception. Contact us today to schedule your wedding venue tour. We will show you all of our wedding spaces, discuss options and learn all about your wedding preferences. Email : info@madisongreencountryclub.com Weddings & Events : (561) 269-7925 Take your time to explore these options and decide which one aligns best with your vision for your special day. And if you need personalized advice, don’t hesitate to book a consultation with our experienced wedding planning team who can help bring your dream wedding to life. Happy planning, and congratulations on your engagement! If you’re planning your dream wedding in this stunning destination, this guide is here to help you find the perfect spot and make your celebration unforgettable. Use this link to download our pricing guide & schedule your wedding venue tour. Why Choose Palm Beach, FL for Your Wedding? Palm Beach offers more than just breathtaking views. It boasts fabulous amenities, convenience, and experiences that make it an exceptional choice for your wedding day. Here are 25 reasons to choose wedding venues in Palm Beach, FL : Unmatched year-round weather. A destination feel without needing a passport for domestic travelers. Iconic Florida beaches for stunning ceremonies or post-wedding photos. Picturesque natural backdrops for your wedding album. Close proximity to luxurious accommodations for you and your guests. Renowned local caterers offering world-class cuisine. Vibrant live music and entertainment scenes. Historical charm mixed with modern luxury at many venues. Easy access for out-of-town guests via Palm Beach International Airport. Unforgettable oceanfront sunsets. A wide variety of venues to match your style (elegant, rustic, tropical, and more). Extensive options for pre-wedding activities, like spa days or yachting. Specialty florists experienced with tropical and elegant arrangements. Incredible shopping and boutiques for wedding wear and accessories. Trusted wedding planners familiar with local venues and vendors. Exclusive private clubs that offer privacy and sophistication. Vibrant nightlife for post-celebration parties. Venues for weddings of all sizes, from intimate to grandiose. Beachfront ceremonies with sophisticated receptions. Horse-and-carriage photo-ops. Sunset yacht cruises for honeymoons or rehearsal dinners. A romantic, escapist vibe everyone can appreciate. World-class golf resorts and spas for wedding party downtime. Local attractions for guest entertainment. A rich local culture that adds personality to every event. Palm Beach isn’t just about weddings; it’s about creating an entire experience for you and your guests. Explore The Breakers, a historic luxury oceanfront resort. Enjoy a scenic bike ride along the Lake Trail. Shop at the high-end boutiques of West Palm Beach. Indulge in a spa day at Eau Palm Beach Resort. Dine at an oceanfront restaurant, like Buccan or The Seafood Bar. Charter a boat or yacht for a sunset cruise. Take a day trip to the Everglades for an airboat tour. Visit Peanut Island and unwind in this local paradise. Enjoy live music at Clematis Street’s vibrant nightlife scene. Play a round of golf at one of Palm Beach’s famous courses. Take a guided art tour at the Norton Museum of Art. Explore the seasonal West Palm Beach GreenMarket. Try snorkeling or scuba diving at Blue Heron Bridge. Discover the Gardens Mall for premier shopping. Enjoy a luxurious high tea service at The Chesterfield Hotel. Visit the Palm Beach Zoo with the little ones. Attend a polo match in Wellington during the season. Explore the Ann Norton Sculpture Gardens. Take a yoga class on the beach. Sip craft cocktails at The Blind Monk wine bar. Discover authentic Cuban cuisine at Havana Restaurant. End the day with a sunset walk along the Intracoastal Waterway. Madison Green Country Club is a top-value favorite among local golfers and savvy visitors in West Palm Beach, FL. Open to the public and located just 20 minutes west of both downtown and Palm Beach International Airport, this championship course has earned rave reviews since its opening in 2001. Golfers are drawn to its fun and varied design, natural setting and wildlife, and consistently pristine playing conditions. Our South Florida Golf Facility Has It All Our practice facilities include a driving range, chipping green with practice bunkers, and putting areas. The clubhouse features a well-stocked golf shop, men’s and women’s locker rooms, and the Marbar Grille offering food and beverages inside and out on the patio. Madison Green Country Club has earned its championship credentials, having hosted U.S. Amateur qualifiers and other important state tournaments. A tee time at Madison Green CC promises to be a fun day of golf with the biggest bang for your buck in West Palm Beach. Par-72 Golf Course This stunning par-72 course winds through a lush, natural landscape, offering fresh challenges and surprises at every turn. Water plays a prominent role on all but one hole, with 42 acres of lakes seamlessly integrated throughout the layout. While back tee players will face some demanding carries, there are often safer, more strategic routes that minimize risk on approach shots. Adding to the test, over 100 well-placed bunkers and waste areas demand precision and smart shot-making.  The greens are expertly manicured, with pronounced slopes and contours, and they offer a quick pace that rewards precise, confident putting. 5 Tee Settings To ensure an enjoyable and rewarding experience for golfers of all skill levels, the course offers five distinct tee options. Renowned for its immaculate conditions, Madison Green features smooth, true-rolling greens and lush, well-manicured fairways. The spectacular design coupled with the extraordinary conditions set this golfing experience apart from anything in Palm Beach County. Natural Surroundings As you make your way through the course, you’ll be immersed in a landscape of Pine Barrens, palm trees, majestic oaks, palmettos, and thousands of native plants. While holmes border some fairways, the dense natural foliage creates a peaceful buffer, offering a sense of seclusion throughout your round. You’ll likely be joined by Florida’s native wildlife, including Great Blue Herons, Sandhill Cranes, Snowy Egrets, hawks, and other birds of prey that call the course home. No Parallel Fairways Renowned course architect John Sanford designed a breathtaking layout that seamlessly weaves through protected nature preserves. The expansive routing offers a dynamic experience, with each hole heading in a unique direction—no two fairways run parallel, ensuring variety and a sense of discovery throughout the round. Experience golf the way it was meant to be played—challenging, scenic, and truly unforgettable. Pro Shop Our fully stocked Pro Shop offers everything a golfer could need—whether you’re a seasoned player or new to the game. Discover top-tier clubs, high-performance golf balls, and stylish, functional apparel. With a curated selection of premium gear and accessories, we’re here to help you play your best and enjoy every round. Premium Full Set Rentals: TaylorMade $65 + tax The rental program includes Srixon Golf Clubs only (with a bag) Have Questions? Our resident Golf Pro Scott Stowell (Director of Golf) is always available or working in our Pro Shop. ✆ 561-718-3888 Annual Passholders Special benefits including unlimited golf, private locker, access to our steam room, preferred tee times, access to special events at discounted prices, & much more. With many years of golf experience, Scott has played & taught golf for over 25 years. The one place that always has and always will be committed to filling our most basic need to connect. We live through our members. From weddings to black-tie affairs, decades of business deals to years of building new friendships, family dinners to the best date nights ever, our walls are filled with stories. To us, our members’ stories are what really matter. WHY JOIN THE MADISON CLUB? While serving the finest food and drinks will forever be a priority, servicing our members and their guests is our way of life. And because of this, members come to dine, to meet their friends, to build their businesses, to celebrate… Our members understand the importance of being present for these real life moments and they know no one does it better than the Madison Club. We know who we are, what we do best, and what matters most to our members. Being the best may be subjective, but being our members “favorite” is critical." IS A PRIVATE CLUB RIGHT FOR YOU? Try us. Simply contact our Membership Director to request a guest pass and set up your visit. We are the experts… IN WEDDINGS Every love story is beautiful but yours should be unique. From the moment you walk through the front doors, you’ll know you’ve arrived somewhere special. The Club boasts multiple floors of event spaces, each with their own distinct personality and character- from enchanting elegance to modern sophistication. Let us help you find the perfect space to tell your love story. Visit our weddings page to learn more. IN DINING Providing you with outstanding cuisine, extraordinary service, and an experience like you won’t find anywhere else in town. At the Club you’ll find our menus consist of a balance between the familiar favorites and the unique and adventurous. For our Executive Chef, creating dishes isn’t just about the food it’s about creating something that brings people together. Visit our dining page to learn more. IN EVENTS We design and execute custom events helping create memorable experiences. We believe that personal attention is the key to successful events. We invite creativity in your event planning. Whether you are seeking dishes to incorporate a unique variety, personal preferences, or family heritage, our talented team looks forward to creating a menu just for you. Let us help you craft your vision. Visit our events page to learn more. IN BUSINESS There’s a reason the Club has been rated Madison’s Best Place for Business. You’ll have access to Madison’s most successful professionals and to events to further your professional growth. First impressions matter, but so do lasting ones. From team meetings to client consultations, our members meet here with confidence and ease because they know there’s no other place that provides service like their Club. Visit our membership page to learn more. We cater to everyone We embrace the classic but we also acknowledge what century we’re in.  We’re the place where you’ll be accepted, appreciated, and welcomed all in the heart of the best the city has to offer.  The Club is unique and so are our members. We’re sophisticated yet casual, we’re worldly yet local, we’re professional yet comfortable.  If you want a place where you feel like you belong, you’ve found it. From networking, business suits, and corporate meetings, to trivia, happy hour, and family night, we cater to it all. BUSINESS & COMMUNITY LEADERS: There’s a reason the Club has been rated Madison’s Best Place for Business. You’ll have access to Madison’s most successful professionals and to events to further your professional growth. SOCIALITES: Did someone say social outing? From black tie affairs to VIP seating at Concerts on the Square, one of a kind wine tastings to pop up restaurant nights, we’ll fill your calendar with great events. FOODIES: We bring you the best food in town by partnering with local farmers and purveyors. And while you’re enjoying your delicious food, pair it with a craft or classic cocktail, we have it all. WEDDING DREAMERS: We eat, sleep, and breathe weddings which is why we are consistently rated one of the best. Whether you have 50 or 200 guests, our expert planners will help you create your perfect day. LIFE PLANNERS: You love to celebrate milestones?! So do we! From baby showers to Bar Mitzvah’s, epic game nights to grand proposals, birthday parties to retirement farewell, we’re there for all of your milestones. MEETING MANIA: Meetings are a must, but the chaos of planning is not. Leave it to the experts. From knowing your favorite room to the food you ordered at your last meeting, we have you covered. FAMILY FUN: Need a date night but can’t find a sitter? No worries, we offer Friday night babysitting, as well as kids’ events, holiday brunches, activities and much more. RETIREES: Good news; our dining rooms are quiet, we know your favorite table, and your drink is always made just how you like it. TRAVELERS & RECREATIONALISTS: You said you like to travel? You like golfing even more? Whether you’re hitting the runway or the fairway, we have stays and rounds of golf at Private Clubs across the country. CITY GURUS: From rooftop lovers to do-gooders, you’ll have the best seats to everything downtown as well as access to the best community focused individuals to join efforts and support the city. AVID LEARNERS: For our learners - we have you covered with WisPolitics, group cooking classes, and Lunch & Learns. Expand your knowledge from the kitchen to the meeting room. EVERYONE & ANYONE: We welcome members who will revel in our old traditions and introduce a few new ones of their own. Ignore the stigmas of a social club, and experience life at the Madison Club. Consider adding a unique twist to your celebration with an array of delightful fall cocktails. Whether you’re hosting a ballroom wedding, a country club affair, or an intimate gathering, these seasonal cocktails are sure to impress your guests and create an unforgettable experience. When it comes to the top 10 Fall Cocktails To Serve At Your Palm Beach Wedding Venue , please let us know if we missed a cocktail that should be on our list, leave us a comment. Why Fall Cocktails? Fall is a magical time to tie the knot in Palm Beach, Fla. The weather is perfect, and the scenery is stunning. What better way to celebrate than by incorporating the flavors of the season into your wedding cocktail menu? Fall cocktails not only add to the ambiance but also offer a unique wedding experience that reflects the charm and elegance of the season. 10 Must-Try Fall Cocktails for Your Palm Beach Wedding 1. Autumn Apple Sangria A refreshing twist on the classic sangria, this cocktail combines crisp apple cider with white wine, brandy, and a medley of fresh fall fruits such as apples, pears, and oranges. It’s a crowd-pleaser that perfectly complements a country club wedding setting. 2. Pumpkin Spice Martini Capture the essence of fall with this delectable martini made from vanilla vodka, pumpkin liqueur, and a touch of coffee liqueur. Garnished with a sprinkle of cinnamon, it’s the perfect addition to a ballroom wedding’s sophisticated cocktail hour. 3. Maple Bourbon Smash This cocktail brings out the cozy flavors of the season with bourbon, maple syrup, lemon juice, and a dash of bitters. It’s both warming and refreshing, making it an excellent choice for a wedding venue that offers an elegant yet relaxed atmosphere. 4. Cranberry Gin Fizz Add a splash of color to your wedding with this vibrant cocktail made from gin, cranberry juice, fresh lime, and a hint of rosemary. It’s a sophisticated option for couples looking to add a pop of color to their cocktail menu. 5. Spiced Pear Collins A luxurious blend of pear vodka, lemon juice, and spiced simple syrup, the Spiced Pear Collins is a chic and refreshing option that pairs beautifully with the lush landscapes of Palm Beach wedding venues. 6. Fig and Thyme Prosecco Smash For a touch of elegance, serve this bubbly cocktail made with fig syrup, fresh thyme, and prosecco. It’s a versatile choice that suits both a ballroom wedding and an outdoor country club setting. 7. Cinnamon Old Fashioned Give this classic cocktail a fall twist by infusing bourbon with cinnamon and adding a splash of maple syrup. It’s an ideal choice for couples who want to offer their guests a familiar yet seasonal drink option. 8. Harvest Mule A fall-inspired take on the traditional Moscow mule, this cocktail features vodka, ginger beer, apple cider, and a dash of allspice. Its spicy notes make it a fitting choice for a warm and inviting wedding setting. 9. Pomegranate Champagne Punch This delightful punch combines pomegranate juice, champagne, and a hint of orange liqueur. It’s a festive option that adds a touch of sparkle to your wedding celebration. 10. Caramel Apple Cider Mimosa Combine apple cider with champagne and a drizzle of caramel for a sweet and sophisticated cocktail that’s perfect for a fall brunch wedding. Your Palm Beach wedding deserves a cocktail menu as unique and beautiful as the venue itself. By incorporating these fall-inspired cocktails, you can create an unforgettable experience that captures the essence of the season and leaves a lasting impression on your guests. background-color: #d81a14; /* the main color */ width: fit-content; } You are here: Home / Weddings & Events / Romantic Places to Visit In Palm Beach, Florida There are so many romantic places in Palm Beach that we will have to provide more articles on this topic! We host so many weddings, engagement parties, anniversaries, elopements and couples styled shoots at Madison Green Country Club. One of the top requests we get from our destination wedding couples is, “can you give us a list of romantic places to visit in Palm Beach?” Couples traveling to West Palm Beach to plan their wedding or for a wedding venue tour of our property, often want to stay for the weekend and enjoy a romantic get away. West Palm Beach Florida is known for its beautiful beaches, vibrant nightlife, wildlife, natural beauty and romantic atmosphere. If you’re looking to plan a romantic getaway with your significant other, look no further than this charming city. From sunset cruises to cozy restaurants, there are plenty of romantic places to visit that are sure to make your trip unforgettable. One of the most popular romantic spots in West Palm Beach is Worth Avenue . This upscale shopping street is lined with designer boutiques, art galleries, and charming cafes. Take a leisurely stroll hand-in-hand with your partner and admire the beautiful architecture and lush landscaping. Treat yourselves to a delicious meal at one of the many restaurants on Worth Avenue or enjoy a glass of wine at a cozy wine bar. This picturesque street is the perfect place to spend an afternoon with your loved one. Another must-visit spot for couples in West Palm Beach is the Ann Norton Sculpture Gardens . This hidden gem features beautiful sculptures set amidst lush gardens and tranquil ponds. Take a peaceful walk through the gardens and admire the artistry of Ann Norton’s work. Pack a picnic lunch and enjoy a romantic meal surrounded by nature. The serene atmosphere of the sculpture gardens makes it a great place for couples looking to escape the hustle and bustle of city life. Photo courtesy of Summer Jordan Photography Madison Green Country Club is the perfect place to visit for couples who enjoy golf. Actually, it’s the perfect place to couples to visit whether your into golf or not. Madison Green Country Club features palm trees, oaks, palmettos, pine barrens and native grasses provide relaxing vibes as you sip custom cocktails from the MarBar Grill & enjoy indoor or outdoor seating. Madison Green Country Club offers 42 acres of lake views and natural beauty. Couples often ask us if they can propose on our grounds, the answer is an enthusiastic, “YES!” We will even help you plan an unforgettable proposal with photography and a champagne toast. Follow us on Instagram . For couples looking for adventure, consider taking a sunset cruise along the Intracoastal Waterway. Several companies offer private charters where you can enjoy breathtaking views of the sunset while sipping champagne with your partner. Watch as the sky transforms into shades of pink and orange, creating a magical backdrop for your romantic evening. Some sunset cruises even include live music or dinner options for an extra special experience. If you’re a fan of live entertainment, be sure to check out a show at the Kravis Center for Performing Arts. This world-class venue hosts a variety of performances including Broadway shows, concerts, ballets, and more. Enjoy an evening out with your partner watching a captivating performance that will leave you both in awe. The elegant ambiance of the Kravis Center sets the stage for an unforgettable night filled with culture and romance. No trip to West Palm Beach would be complete without visiting Peanut Island Park . This small island located just off the coast is accessible by boat or water taxi. Spend a day exploring Peanut Island’s crystal-clear waters perfect for snorkeling or paddleboarding together as you soak up the sun on its sandy beaches. Pack a picnic lunch and relax under shady palm trees while taking in stunning views of Singer Island across from you. Whether you’re looking for relaxation or adventure, West Palm Beach offers plenty of romantic places to visit that are sure to create lasting memories with your significant other. From charming streets lined with boutiques to tranquil sculpture gardens and thrilling sunset cruises along the waterway, there’s something for every couple to enjoy in this enchanting city by the sea. Madison Green Country Club is locally owned and operated. We hope to encourage engaged couples to consider choosing a locally owned wedding venue. We go to great lengths to exceed expectations and you will find that locally owned wedding venues have far less turn over and that leads to better communication! Here are 5 locally owned wedding venues around the US, we love shouting out and supporting our locally owned wedding venue and wedding business colleagues. Madison Green Golf Lodge Madison Green Golf Lodge Description Location Gallery Documents Dates FAQ Contact Homepage Madison Green Country Club New Construction 108-room Golf Lodge Project Description Madison Green Country Club is partnering with Marriott and its upscale affiliate, Springhill Suites, to build a 108 room Golf Lodge at the entrance to the Madison Green Country Club.  The Golf Lodge will complement the existing golf course and event center and will be a flagship lodge. Project Location and Added Amenities Property is located on the west side of Crestwood Boulevard at the entrance to the Madison Green Country Club. Gallery Important Dates Neighborhood Meetings TBD Frequently Asked Questions Why do we want to build a golf lodge? To ensure the viability of a beautifully maintained golf course so that residents will continue to have picturesque views and open space. Will views of the golf course be affected? No, the site has been carefully selected to ensure that no residents’ views of the golf course will be blocked or affected. Will the golf lodge create congestion or traffic? No, a traffic study performed by Simmons and White, a well-respected local firm, concluded that the proposed Golf Lodge traffic would be considered an insignificant impact to the surrounding roadway network. Madison Green Traffic Letter How will the lodge benefit the community? The Golf Lodge will provide upscale lodging by Marriott one of the most well-known and respected lodging providers in the world. Marriott’s Springhill Suites brand was selected because it is family oriented. All residents of the Community will receive a friends and family discounted rate when staying at the lodge, creating a convenient place for your guests to stay. Marriott will also accept accumulated reward points for stays. We believe that infusing over 20 million dollars for the Lodge and improvements of the golf course, will increase the values of surrounding homes. If a need should arise to move out of your home (repair/renovations), the lodge will be close and available. In addition, there will be generators located at the Golf Lodge to provide electricity for the lodge in case of a major storm or hurricane. This is a long term commitment by us to keep a beautifully maintained championship golf course and facility. The Golf Lodge will allow for added security around the property. The addition of the Golf Lodge will include a full service restaurant for the community to dine at. The lodge facilities will bring an increased tax base and jobs to the community. How many rooms will the lodge have? 108. Who is building the lodge? The current ownership of Madison Green Country Club, which has owned the course and Club for approximately 15 years, is partnering with Marriott to build a Spring Hill Suites Golf Lodge. Who will construct and manage the hotel? Naples Hotel Group with 25 + years in hotel management and development will oversee the construction and management of the Golf lodge Will guests of the lodge have access to any of the amenities of the Madison Green HOA? No.  The Lodge will have its own pool, fitness center, locker room, and other amenities.  Lodge guests will not have access to Madison Green HOA facilities. When is the anticipated start date and completion date for construction? Construction is estimated to start in 2025 and to be completed in 2026/2027. Will local residents have to contribute any funds for the golf lodge? No. Will Madison Green still remain a public course? Yes. How long is Madison Green Country Club required to remain a golf course? There is currently a restrictive covenant requiring the course to remain a public golf course for 30 years. There are only a few years left on this restriction. We are willing to extend this deed restriction upon the approval of the Golf Lodge. Will any amenities be taken away from the golf course? No. It will remain a 7,000 yard + par 72 championship golf course. The course will add a new practice facility and will improve the overall conditions of the golf course. Will the Golf Lodge create a lot of noise? No.  The Lodge will have concrete block construction with hurricane impact glass.  There will be no balconies. Will the Golf Lodge appearance and character be in keeping with our Community? Yes. We are working with the Village to match existing architecture as much as possible and try to keep the lodge within the limited height requirements with no variances. The most the height would differ is 3 feet. Learn more about Marriott Springhill Suites https://springhillsuites.marriott.com/ Have you been communicating with the residents and stakeholders? Yes, we have been proactive with our public outreach.  Some particular public outreach efforts include: Publishing this project webpage Setting up a project hotline for residents and stakeholders to call with any questions or concerns Mailed informational postcards to all residents Mailed a meeting notice and held a public meeting on June 18 What does a typical Springhill Suites by Marriott look like?
